png

Class PngChunkZTXT

  • java.lang.Object
    • png.PngChunk
      • png.PngChunkZTXT

  • public class PngChunkZTXT
extends PngChunk
    Extended to support a zTXt (compressed textual data) chunk in a PNG file.

    This class provides decoding support for PNG zTXt chunks, which store compressed Latin-1 text paired with a keyword.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Detail

      • PngChunkZTXT

        public PngChunkZTXT(long length,
                    byte[] typeBytes,
                    int crc32,
                    byte[] data)
        Constructs a PngChunkZTXT instance.

        According to the PNG specification, the chunk format is:

        • Keyword: 1–79 bytes (Latin-1), followed by a null byte
        • Compression method: 1 byte (only value 0 is valid for zlib/deflate)
        • Compressed text: remaining bytes, compressed using zlib
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the chunk's data field (excluding type and CRC)
        typeBytes - the raw 4-byte chunk type
        crc32 - the CRC value read from the file
        data - raw chunk data

        Checks whether this chunk contains the specified textual keyword.
        Overrides:
        hasKeywordPair in class PngChunk
        Parameters:
        keyword - the TextKeyword to search for
        Returns:
        true if found, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified keyword is null

      • getKeywordPair

        public java.util.Optional<TextEntry> getKeywordPair()
        Extracts and de-compresses the keyword-text pair from this zTXt chunk.
        Overrides:
        getKeywordPair in class PngChunk
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the extracted the keyword and the de-compressed text as a TextEntry instance if present, otherwise, Optional.empty()

        public java.lang.String getKeyword()

        the keyword text, or an empty string if parsing failed during construction
